Posted By: Teotanek (2/14/2010 11:37:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Typical "money wins" card. Anyone not giving this a 5 is doing so out of spite or because of the awful artwork; hey I can understand both. But this card really is in the highest tier of creatures, an indisputable fact.  
  
Even Wizards admitted that printing this was a mistake...and yet they have done nothing further about it, huh. I imagine the outrageous market price has something to do with it (hint: it boosted Future Sight pack and box sales all by itself; so of course they aren't going to ban/restrict it. That would be stupid if they wanted to make more money.)  
  
The good news is, combo decks become more powerful the further back you go (Extended -> Legacy, etc) so Goyf may be in several decklists, but there are many many more in which he isn't an auto-4-of, proving that while he can compete against other powerful strategies, he isn't the "auto-win" card he's made out to be.  
  
The real reason this card is so powerful is that it grows with the game, and you can splash for it in any deck... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Typical "money wins" card. Anyone not giving this a 5 is doing so out of spite or because of the awful artwork; hey I can understand both. But this card really is in the highest tier of creatures, an indisputable fact.

Even Wizards admitted that printing this was a mistake...and yet they have done nothing further about it, huh. I imagine the outrageous market price has something to do with it (hint: it boosted Future Sight pack and box sales all by itself; so of course they aren't going to ban/restrict it. That would be stupid if they wanted to make more money.)

The good news is, combo decks become more powerful the further back you go (Extended -> Legacy, etc) so Goyf may be in several decklists, but there are many many more in which he isn't an auto-4-of, proving that while he can compete against other powerful strategies, he isn't the "auto-win" card he's made out to be.

The real reason this card is so powerful is that it grows with the game, and you can splash for it in any deck... (see all)

Posted By: Atmos (3/4/2010 2:06:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: For all the people who say "it dies to removal", so does nearly every other creature. It's still overpowered. Furthermore, blue doesn't care if you have a way to deal with it, because they can stop you from doing it. Goyf's extremely efficient cost allows you to play him AND have mana open to protect him. There's a reason why he's considered one of the best finishers for mono-blue ever made.
posts.html:

Posted By: Vandrace (10/5/2009 6:50:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: yup, because of this guy, I run creature removal galore. Luckliy, w/ Tombstalker, I can shave off the unnecessary parts of my graveyard so that the goyf won't get pumped on my account. It still makes it frightening to dredge a life from the loam, just knowing that you might be making this into a giant. I main-deck putrefies, just b/c every other legacy deck seems to be running this and jitte--two cards, that if you leave on the board for more than a couple turns, will end you. This might even make me SB bojuka bog...in LEGACY.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: [Bojuka Bog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bojuka Bog) just made this card cry to it's mommy. So did just about all the removal in shards/zen/WW.[Journey to Nowhere](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Journey to Nowhere)[Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile)[Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring)[Iona's Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iona's Judgment)[Admonition Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Admonition Angel). BTW, I know this is obviously an answer to EVERY CREATURE CARD that doesn't have prot white or shroud, HOWEVER, deny tarmogoyf doesn't have the exact same problems as Mycoloth and I will laugh at you for days. Good card, but easily remedied. Hello, [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) [Eradicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eradicate)
